alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Pierce; Thurston; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 28 at 3:20AM CST until January 28 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 to 30 below zero. * WHERE...Thurston, Antelope, Pierce and Wayne Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Winds gusting over 30 mph will create areas of blowing snow and low visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...most of the snow accumulation will be before Noon, with amounts an inch or less expected this afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
